alert.note: Alert for Dearborn; Franklin (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 13 at 5:21PM EDT until June 13 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wilmington has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Franklin County in southeastern Indiana... Northeastern Dearborn County in southeastern Indiana... * Until 600 PM EDT. * At 521 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Lake Santee, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Batesville, Brookville, Bright, Oldenburg, Lake Santee, Blooming Grove, Metamora, St. Leon, Laurel, West Harrison, Cedar Grove, Mount Carmel, Mounds State Recreation Area, Huntersville, Hamburg, Interstate 74 at US Route 52, Rockdale, Peppertown, Sharptown and Saint Peter. This includes the following Interstates... I-74 in Indiana between mile markers 145 and 148, and between mile markers 158 and 171. I-74 in Ohio near mile marker 0. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
